description: Grading weights and scale definitions for website analysis

weightsDescription.design: Design and UX quality - most visible to visitors, biggest impact on conversions
weightsDescription.seo: Technical SEO - determines search visibility and organic traffic
weightsDescription.content: Content quality and completeness - builds trust and provides value
weightsDescription.social: Social media presence - extends reach and builds credibility

A.label: Excellent
A.description: Excellent website with minor optimization opportunities only
A.outreachAngle: Already strong foundation - focus on advanced optimizations and growth strategies
A.expectedIssues: 1-3 minor issues, mostly quick-wins or nice-to-haves

B.label: Good
B.description: Good foundation with clear improvement opportunities
B.outreachAngle: Solid site but specific improvements could significantly boost results
B.expectedIssues: 3-5 issues with mix of quick-wins and strategic improvements

C.label: Needs Work
C.outreachAngle: Working site but missing key elements that drive conversions and traffic

D.label: Poor
D.description: Major issues requiring substantial redesign or rebuild
D.outreachAngle: Significant problems costing leads - redesign would provide clear ROI

F.label: Failing
F.outreachAngle: Site is actively hurting business - immediate action needed
F.expectedIssues: 12+ issues, multiple critical failures, possibly better to rebuild than fix

quickWinBonus.description: Add 5 points if 3 or more quick-win fixes are identified

industryOptimization.description: Add 3 points if site follows industry best practices

brokenSite.description: Subtract 20 points if website fails to load or has critical errors

mobileFailure.description: Subtract 15 points if site is not mobile-friendly

securityIssues.description: Subtract 10 points for missing HTTPS or security warnings

missingScores.description: Default scores if analysis cannot be completed (e.g., website failed to load)

industryAdjustments.description: Future feature: Adjust weights based on industry (e.g., restaurants prioritize mobile, B2B prioritizes content)

gradingExamples.description: Poor across the board, needs major work
Average scores but quick-win bonus pushes to B grade

notes: Weights are configurable and can be adjusted based on business needs
Design and SEO weighted equally (30% each) as most impactful for web design agency
Content and social each 20% - important but secondary to core web design
Quick-win bonus encourages finding easy fixes that show immediate value
Grade boundaries designed so most sites fall in B-C range (realistic improvement opportunities)
A grades are rare - reserved for genuinely excellent websites
F grades indicate serious problems or non-functional sites
